intro: Gratiola ramosa, commonly known as the branched yellowroot, is a perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its roots are tuberous and have a yellowish color, which gives it its common name. Gratiola ramosa is often found in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in woodland edges.
